Mayor's Page

Mayor Dan Davis: A Visionary Leader Committed to Manvel’s Future


I am a dedicated public servant, a trusted leader, and an innovative thinker committed to making Manvel a better place for every resident. As a devoted husband and father of two, I have deep roots in the community—living just down the street from my parents and working every day to ensure Manvel thrives for future generations.

Elected as the youngest City Councilmember in Manvel’s history (2019-2022), I quickly built a reputation for challenging the status quo, cutting through bureaucracy, and putting people before politics. In 2023, I was elected Mayor with 64% of the vote, becoming one of the youngest mayors in America. My leadership is centered on transparency, trust, and bold decision-making that moves the city forward.

My passion for service extends far beyond politics. Before entering public office, my wife, Erica, and I served as missionaries in Japan—an experience that reinforced my belief in the power of relationships, understanding different perspectives, and leading with humility.

As Mayor, I have championed policies that empower residents and businesses alike.
Under my leadership, Manvel has:
✅ Renegotiated development agreements to prioritize the needs of the community.
✅ Cut burdensome regulations that stifled economic growth and investment.
✅ Secured Manvel’s first grocery store—HEB, improving local access to essential goods.
✅ Reduced unnecessary costs for residents, including establishing the first-ever Homestead Exemption.
✅ Rewrote city policies, strengthening fiscal responsibility, preparing for the future, and putting people first.

Most importantly, I have focused on molding Manvel into a government that truly serves the people—restoring trust, encouraging open dialogue, and ensuring that every decision reflects the values of the residents I represent.

Beyond my official duties, I am deeply engaged in the community. Whether volunteering with local organizations, mentoring students, or working alongside neighbors, I believe leadership is about action, not just words. In my free time, I enjoy spending time with my family, training for marathons, and indulging in my love for cookie dough.

I am not just leading Manvel—I am building a legacy of trust, innovation, and progress. My mission is clear: a government that listens, a city that thrives, and a future that works for everyone.

 Education
 Graduate - Kingwood High School
 Associate Degree - Christ For the Nations Institute
 Bachelor's Degree, with Honors - Oral Roberts University
 
Business & Professional
Project Manager at Irth Solution
Licensed Realtor - Sparrow Realty

Civic & Community Activity
Board Member - The Yellow Out Campaign
Board Member - ActionS, Inc.
Former Board Member - Alvin Manvel Area Chamber of Commerce
Former Board Member - American Cities Counties Exchange
Alvin ISD YET Mentor
Rotarian - Alvin Sunrise Rotary Club
Member - Alvin-Manvel Chamber of Commerce

Keep Up with the Latest City News!

  1. City of Manvel Receives Superior Public Water System Designation from TCEQ

    The City of Manvel received a Superior Public Water System designation from the Texas Commission on Environmental Quality (TCEQ) last month, recognizing its overall excellence in all aspects of operating a public water system. Read on...

  2. Administrative Offices Closed January 19

    Manvel administrative offices will be closed on Monday, January 19, 2026, in observance of Martin Luther King Jr. Day. Read on...

  3. Utility Billing Announces Changes to Online Processing Fees

    Beginning January 2026, a 2% processing fee will be applied to online payments made for utility services. Customers can AVOID processing fees entirely by submitting an Automatic Payment Plan Application to the Utility Billing department. Read on...

  4. Apply for a Board or Commission!

    The City of Manvel is seeking passionate individuals to apply for positions on PD&Z and MEDC! Candidates must submit their applications by December 31, 2025. Read on...

  5. Christmas and New Year's Closures

    Manvel administrative offices will close at noon on December 24, and remain closed December 25 and December 26, 2025, in observance of the Christmas holiday. Offices will also be closed January 1, 2026, for New Year's Day. Read on...

  6. Holiday Lights Showdown 2025

    The Holiday Lights Showdown is back again, inviting residents to showcase their creativity, holiday spirit, and dazzling displays this festive season! Read on...
